talk.message:
I'm not sure what to do here about price, with the "your net, after commission" 

I assume that 'commission' means a cut that the 'system' takes out, so I have inflated the price to compensate.

Project duration is variable. I'm capable of getting the entire video cut in 2 days if working solo. The speed of the project will depend on the speed of our correspondence. There will also be a delay when we hire a voice actor. (proposal: $824)
Outline sent Via Email
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Outline completed
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Conversation in email
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
This is a test, this is a test.
I am now testing the format, I'd really like to see if this changes.

Something that really bothers me in many web apps, is how when I click "send" that my formatting is completely wiped out. I tend to ramble, and the only way it makes sense is if I'm able to visually separate it into paragraphs. Lets see how this works.

Lets see how this works.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Quick update: My friend Mike recorded his VO, it far surpasses what Jaci can do. I'm editing it to the music right now so you can get the full effect. I'll send you a file once it's done to see how you like it as soon as I'm done.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Alright, I've got the VO synced up. Let me know what you think!
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Alright sounds good. Make sure not to approve until you're 100% on all the audio. If you can give me the time (in seconds) for where you think needs modification it'd help. Look forward to hearing from you tomorrow!
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
I'd be happy to change the volume levels at :38 and at 1:25. Technically, the decibel levels are consistent with the rest of the spot, but due to their relative place (following silence) I understand that they feel a little intense.

I want to challenge you about :45 and mikes voice around :50.

The volume doesn't continually decrease/slope. As I listen I have my eyes on the audio levels, There a 16db decrease in volume from :41 to :43, and then the volume of the music is constant until the very end.

Because there's a break in VO for 1 second at :46, it might feel like there's a need to fill that gap, but it's something that's completely normal and how I'd mix the volume for any television spot.

If we tamper too much with the natural levels of the music we're going to look back on this and cringe saying "what were we thinking?"

Also, I'm not hearing what you're hearing in regards to mikes voice. I've listened to the track, and I've listened to the raw audio track as well. It's completely consistent across the board.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Actually, fixing the volume at that one point seemed to fix some of the other problems too... check it out.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Yup, that's the one! I always try to name the files with the date to avoid confusion.

Me clearing up the volume on those two parts made the volume fluxiations in other parts less dramatic.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Glad we got the audio approved. I'm going to start animating today.

Do you want to pay VO Actor directly via paypal, or do you want to channel it through me?
For reference his paypal is: "subgu@yahoo.com" and he asked for $100 for the VO
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Also, for the graphics, please vide me any assets you have. Any artwork you got produced for videocutters, the logo vector, etc.

Will help a lot, even if just for inspiration. thx
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Mike Lynch, Paypal is Subgu@yahoo.com He originally quoted $150, But I told him that $100 would be a better deal for you. I'll let him know to expect something from you
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Alright, this is the visual direction I'm heading in for the beginning, I want to verify it with you before I spend too much time on it.

Note; it's not timed, there's no audio, no transitions, but just a general sense of what I'd like to do.

The background image is based off of the background of this site. The main color of the video is color picked from the 'action' buttons of videocutters...

I do need a third color for some slides. Do you have another color in mind you'd like to represent Videocutters?
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Added annotations myself to try it out.

It occurred to me to try out a red/orange color based off of the shirt in the main image on the homepage.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Quick Update:
Making steady progress. I'm creating a ton of assets that just didn't quite work out, but it's all part of the process.

Sometimes I'll create something and think "That looks too flat" and have to redo it. Or I'll create something that looks "too gimmicky" or "too cartoony" so there's a lot of refining.

I want to make sure the video graphics reflect your unique style:
fun and accessible.... yet clean and professional.
---------

In the preview video I had already sent, I had silhouettes of people floating in the BG and icons of calendars floating in the BG...

I am persisting with this theme throughout the video to keep consistency.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
I want you to understand the workflow of motion graphics:

Rendering examples takes a long time.
This render took 3.5 hours. That's 3.5 hours where I can't make adjustments, can't take calls, can't even check my email without the computer crashing. Rendertime is render time.

So it's not that I didn't want to work more closely throughout the initial creation process, it's just time management. I can't afford to render out peviews at the end of everyday because it just takes so long.

That being said... in this version there's a major glitch. A portion from the ending of the video managed to insert itself behind the graphics during the first 17 seconds of the video.

I'd rather just show it to you as is rather than wait another 3.5 hours to rerender and fix it.

ALSO:
Very rough. Transitions and timing aren't 100%. I need you to give me the OK before I spend the time making sure everything's smooth. You should get the general idea from this though.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: I will wait until you have a chance to look over it again tomorrow before I make any changes. I need a vector image of the mascot if you want him fully featured in the video.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Is there a way to manually flip the last two milestone percentages?
I made a mistake when setting up the project.

After we agree on the video itself, I need to test it, which requires some capital $$. The 28% should be after this step, as it accounts for the capital.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Workflow time on this machine is taking a LOT longer than it should.
I'm used to getting projects like this busted out in a DAY.

If you'll remember, in January I had delays because the hard-drive failed and I had to replace it myself. I'm starting to think the other components are going. Screen's flickering, memory's disappearing, it's making noises.

It shouldn't take me 3 hours to render a preview of a video just to see the 'flow'. It should take 3 MINUTES.

I'm working on raising the funds to get myself a new machine. Once the replacement coms in I'll be moving a lot faster on all future projects I apologize this is taking so long.


As for creating assets, we should wait until this project is done.
Adapting things I'm already using would take just as long as creating it from scratch, so there's no advantage to creating reusable assets this second, it'd slow things down even more.

When I move on to actually ranking this video on youtube, we'll make a plan for how I can make some reusable assets, with which you can quickly and create as many videos as needed with any cheap outsourced video editor.

Sorry again about the delays.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
A useful feature to implement for the site would be the ability for me to download all your annotations at once as a PDF or TXT.

I keep having to come back to the site to look at the site to review notes which isn't productive for workflow.

If editors had a way to export notes all at once, it'd make it easier for them to do the revisions.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Any additional thoughts on that orange color?
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Things like color are not minor changes on my end. We change one color and it means me recreating a large percentage of the video from scratch again.

I'm restructuring the backend of the video so I can make adaptive changes moving forward. I'm linking effects/settings/expressions to each other to make changes easier moving forward.

I apologize it's taking so long.

Once I can confirm that the backend's good I will be rending off 10 second segments for you to approve individually.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
I think it would be best to tackle each individual piece separately. 

Tell me your general thoughts on this segment.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: This is the Videocutters "5 minutes of fame" reimagined. Tell me what you think.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
I totally get where you're coming from, I didn't quite understand before. Photography+Licenses of people's faces can be expensive.

I might have a work-around... I own some stock video, I can take stills from these to use and there will be no breach in license contract.

They WON'T be editors sitting behind desks though, which is really what we need. Do you have access to such shots yourself?
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Yes, I do have something to show you. Sorry it's been a while...  I kept improving it and improving it. I have 3 different versions of of the editors part I want to show you and get your opinion on. I will upload shortly.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Alright. I've got three versions. I have a version that I like more than the others, I'd like to hear what you think first thought.They're labeled "Arrows" "Glass" and "Blue Strip"
talk.title: Message

talk.message: I uploaded 3 files in previous message. Let me know if all of them went through
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
I can not set a target date for this until I receive my new workstation.

This wasn't a problem I anticipated when I took on the project. This should have only taken a week maximum from start to finish.

I anticipate this wrapping up 3 days after my workstation arrives.

I am unsure what you mean about fonts. All fonts are consistent throughout everything I've sent. They're all Helvetica Bold.

And yes, all visuals need to be refined to be better timed to the music across the board. This only takes a few minutes on the tail end once the visual styling is locked down.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
I'm working off an older machine right now, so I can still make progress, just not as fast as I'd like. I sent my Main workstation to Dave, the guy who builds this stuff for me.

He says it'll cost the same $ to repair as it will to replace. Sunday night he'll have a list of specs for me to approve. Then he'll order the parts and I should receive it a week later after he builds it.

I JUST raised the money for it, which has been on my mind the past week. The new rig costs around $8K and I had to creatively work out JV deals with businesses to raise the funds.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Just to let you know I haven't been idle. whenever I can't work directly on the video I've been working on competitive research to make everything go faster when it's finally done.

I'm studying what our competitors are doing wrong that we can take advantage of.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Looks like it should be pretty easy to get to #1 based on my research. The people at the top are years old and not pushing anymore.

They reached page on of google but are still near the bottom and not seeing the #s they would if they were at the top.

Nobody in the top 50 competitors has a single "favorite", which tells me that they either have no idea how to rank, or they're operating off of outdated information.

I forget how empty the space is for videos. I've had my head in the game for so long It amazes me nobody else is doing it yet.

I've attached my findings of the top 50 competitors (although we only really need to worry about the to 5-10.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Agreed lets get this done.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
So there are a few graphical glitches I'm ironing out now (font flickering in a few places) and the timing's a TINY bit off near the tail end.

Let me know what you think.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Arik, FYI, I'm not seeing the latest notes as being in english.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
I made the changes. I need to know what you mean about the different packages in order to change it. There was obviously a miscommunication somewhere.

I feel it's important to retinroduce the logo just before the CTA for conversions. I think it's fine, is there a reason you wanted it changed?
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Throughout the entire video, I only use:
Blue, Orange, Black, White.

Any apparent variations of those colors comes from 3d lighting set up within the scene casting shadows and highlights on the elements.

The blue we used as the background at the very end is the same blue that's used for the text at the beginning. This was color picked directly from the buttons on your site, but was given additional shading and lighting to give it dimension so it doesn't look flat. Same for all other elements. Flat = Cheap and we want to attrack higher paying customers.

The only color inconsistancy is from the 'timer' at the beginning.

As the video stands now it will do its job in bringing customers to your website and preselling them, although I do understand the need for your video to 

It's ultimately your video so you're free to decide.
Visually reconstructing the video with external assets is basically starting from scratch. I can do it but I will need to log my hours and charge for it, and it would add additional weeks.

I'd be happy to hand the project over to your designer if they think they'll understand. I used Adobe After Effects, with the plugins: Element3d, Optical Flares, Trapcode Particular, Trapcode Lux. All scenes are setup in 3d space, with in-engine lighting.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: I used premiere to edit the audio. Literally everything else was done inside of after effects
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
I'm going to ask that you pay the remaining milestones before I release the project files.

I've been working on the visuals since april 01 without taking on any other clients. 

Once I hand it over I have no idea how long it will take your designers to change the project file, but this is still 2 months of investment on my end and I need to pay bills.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Arik, I'm sending you an invoice via paypal for $100 for the changes.

From an email conversation we held on Feb 16th:
"I want to nail down EACH part of the video before I move onto the next step. I'd like to set up a $100 fee in the event that we have to go back to a previous step. This isn't meant to be a 'jerk' move, but only to reenforce the severity of consequence. I need you to be 100% certain about moving forward before we move forward. I don't want to pay a few hundred dollars worth of stock footage, only for you to decide after the fact that we're not heading in the right direction.

I didn't used to do things this way, but I just had a client who refused to pay the $3,000 that we agreed upon because I was on the TESTING phase, and he wanted to change the script... which meant redoing the entire video."

On that note: I think The videocutters milestone system needs to be more flexible. Additional invoices should be sent right through the system. Elance handles this well. With elance you can modify milestones and send invoices unrelated to milestones through the system,

Unexpected project changes come up all the time, and the last thing you want is for people to start performing transactions outside of videocutters to bypass this restriction.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
This all looks good. I'll get started immediately.

I do have 2 issues:

#1: I think that showing the homescreen image from is a horrible idea. There's got to be another solution. I will be trying something for this portion of the video to see what you think. If you like it, then great. If not, I'll do what you recommend here.


#2: “Or, choose one of our packages…”
This point in the video will be too text heavy. Showing all the packages and prices is a waste of time; The viewer doesn't have time to internalize the different concepts, prices, AND follow along with the narration. We cant force the viewer to start reading and comprehending pricepoints mid-video.

I will see how this works with the names and not the prices, but I think that will even be too much. The reason the original graphics here used symbols (music note, dollar sign, rattle) is because words don't work here. We'll lose retention and momentum and CTR.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
I also need you to attach the best resolution jpeg of the 'proposals' as you can get, or provide me with a login so I can screencapture video of the page myself.

The screencapture provided isn't big enough.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Here's the first 48 seconds, everything up until that first screencapture.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
1)I still don't understand why you think that the blue background is a different shade. I used #0156B9 for both the blue strips, any blue text, and the blue BG.

2) I agree with you here. They're wacky. Needs refinement. I just couldn't have them radiate from the center without the center piece there to mask the origin point of the particle emitter.

3)Agreed. I understand the need for continuity and stylistic uniformity.

I'm not asking for $ to deliver what you've been asking for. I'm asking for it because when we originally created the script, there was no mention of screen capture, capturing images from the site, or anything of the sort.

I would not have animated the 45 seconds of motion graphics in the first place if I knew we'd be doing screen captures instead. That was an unnecessary 15-20 hours of work, which is now completely down the drain. 15 hours is a HUGE deal for me at this stage in my business. I'm currently charging webinar leads $100/hr for online video coaching so I'm sure you can imagine what that time's worth to me.

Don't fear, I don't plan on invoicing again, unless there is another MAJOR adjustment which nullifies all of this current work. I think I've been fairly accomidating considering the amount of time that's been put into this.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
I can take all of them myself, except for the "proposals." I need multiple photos of a project that was FLOODED with proposals. If the whole page doesn't fit on the screen at once, you can take a screencapture, scroll, take another one, etc.

I can stich them together myself in photoshop.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Will have something for you soon Finishing up the annotation/feedback system portion now. Then all I have to do is the guarantee and outro.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Here's the uploaded video.
I'll gladly make any changes you want to it,
but I want to explain the reasoning behind some things first.

#1: The very last screen I wanted to be blue, with an orange button on top. I recently gave a webinar on this very tactic. Orange is an alert/action color. Blue is it's complimentary color.. putting an orange action button on a blue background is the most effective way to get clicks.

#2: Working backwards from the final slide, the initial introduction of the videocutters logo was also placed on a blue background to keep that consistancy in place.

#3: I replaced the badge, so we could keep that blue background but make it look a bit nicer
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
1) Sure thing. Done.

2) The last thing you want for your call to action is subtlety. This is direct marketing in the truest sense. The arrows and button 100% WORK and are how I drove thousands of clicks when I did herbal 
supplement videos.

No distactions, nothing to soften the sell. At this point they've watched 1:30 of advertising for your service. They're either interested of they're not. Adding your logo, tagline, anything would take away from the compulsion to click.

At that point int he video, they know who you are, they know what you do, they know your style and what you represent, they understand your branding. The only thing we need for them to do is click the button.

If you REALLY want, I'll change it. It'd only take me a few minutes... but I want you to know that we'd exchanging design for results.

3)We just need to get your youtube channel verified and associated with your website. I did it with this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_nl6ANkofPo

Right in the beginning, when it says "Your company name here"..
I added a spotlight annotation which links back to my website.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
PS: Before you make your decision regarding the CTA, please reread chapter 9 here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/jwd0bkpgzom008e/doctorconversion10eviltricks.pdf

PPS: Chapter 7 covers the external annotation features.
talk.title: Message

talk.message: Here's the version without the change in the CTA. If you decide you want changes to the final slide, I'll make those and send you that version
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Yes, I will need to set up external annotations.
And then we need to figure out a way to release some extra cash so I can start sending paid traffic to the offer.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Ok this is going to be a bit complicated.

Ideally we'd have a seperate youtube account for each seperate keyword we want to rank for.. this is the way I rank for affiliate and CPA offers. It's a tiny bit faster.

But because you're a BRAND and not just doing random videos, it's a bad idea. The annotation feature won't work on future videos, We will want ALL your videos on the same account.

We will not just need a google account, but some other steps may need an official email account associated. I suggest you create an official email account on the VideoCutters domain. Probably something like Media@Videocutters.com and set it up with a password we can both access.

We can create a youtube account using that... we can optimize it later. When signing up with that email we will use your name and age, except you should make the location the United States, which google seems to be preferring as of late.

If you have trouble registering (or your IP is locked out of signing up for the united states) I can do it.
talk.title: Message

talk.message:
Do you already have an account you're hosting videocutters stuff at? It might be enough... it might not. Hard to tell unless I see it.

To sign up for a new account, head to Youtube.com from a browser and click "sign in". Then click "don't have an account?" and then you can link any email address to the new youtube account.

Everything affects ranking. The email account linked to the Youtube channel, the metadata of uploaded videos, the filenames of uploaded avatars, thumbnails, profile pictures, custom backgrounds.

Youtube uses every single piece of data it gets in determining a ranking. Most people don't think of it and it gives them a disadvantage when ranking videos.

Normally... I create a new email address and new associated google account for every new keyword I rank for.

This is something I cut in the summer of last year, it may help to wrap your head around the fundamentals of what I'll be doing to rank: http://www.castleforgemedia.com/videoseo01/
talk.title: Message
